sense.def: Pathological Condition Combined Designation of all types of chuang 瘡 , sores, conditions resulting from externally inflicted injury. Ming yi bie lu 名醫別錄 Substance Entry xia ma 蝦蟆：療陰蝕疽癘惡瘡，猘犬傷瘡 , “It cures erosion in the genital region, impediment-illness epidemics, malign sores, as well as wounds inflicted by rabid dogs”. Shang feng 傷風 , harm caused by wind [15]
① Pathological Mechanism of harm caused by wind evil qi. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 11: 夫瘧皆由傷暑及傷風所 為 , “Now, all states of malaria result from harm caused by summerheat or harm caused by wind ”.

② Pathological Condition of a light condition resulting from an external affection by wind. Tai ping hui min he ji Recipe book. Northern Song, ju fang 1107~1110. 太平惠民和劑局方 1: 尋常些小傷風，頭痛鼻塞，項強筋急 , “These are various minor types of harm caused by wind , with headache, a blocked nose, a stiff neck, and tense sinews”. Shang han 傷寒 , harm caused by cold [383]

Alternative Names si shi shang han 四時傷寒 , harm caused by cold in all seasons. Pathological Condition a) general reference to heat diseases resulting from external affection. Nan jing 難經 58: 傷寒有五，有中風，有傷寒，有濕温，有熱病，有温病，其所苦各不 同 , “There are five types of harm caused by cold , including wind stroke, harm caused by cold , moisture-warmth, heat disease, and warmth disease. The symptoms one suffers from are all different”.b) Special reference to all heat diseases brought forth by external affection by cold evil. Shang han lun 傷寒論 Shang han li 傷寒例 , examples of harm caused by cold : 冬時嚴寒，萬物深藏，君子固密，則不傷 於寒，觸冒之者，乃名傷寒耳 , “In winter, when it is very cold, all things go into deep hiding. The gentleman closes himself in tightly, and will not be harmed by cold. If someone is struck by malicious [cold] nevertheless, this is called harm caused by cold ”.
